revised_title: Geophysical Lineaments and Deep Continental Structure: A Study of Major Crustal Lineaments and Their Influence on Geological History
tldr: This article explores the influence of major crustal lineaments on the geological history of the continental lithosphere. It discusses the detection and study of geophysical lineaments using various remote sensing techniques, such as gravimetry, magnetometry, and seismology. The author highlights the importance of understanding the deep structure of the lithosphere and the role of lineaments in shaping the Earth's crust through processes like faulting, shearing, and plate tectonics.
